Authors: Hidayat C., Putong I., Puspokusumo R.A.A.W.
Title: The interrelationship between intellectual capital and financial performance: A case study of indonesian insurance companies
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hidayat, C., Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putong, I., Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Puspokusumo, R.A.A.W., Department of Management, School of Business Management, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to confirm the interrelationship between intellectual capital and financial performance by examining 9 (nine) public-listed Indonesian insurance companies' financial statements from 2009 to 2013. Through this, it expects to determine which variables were more influential to intellectual capital and financial performance using secondary, time series, and panel data. Based on Canonical analysis results, the dominant influence on the financial performance of intellectual capital rather than vice versa. Granger causality analysis results indicate that all the variables of intellectual capital and financial performance can be mutually influential. Not all variables have a significant influence one with another. The variables that have significant influence among one another is HCE to ROA, ROE to SCE, and ROA to ROE (not vice versa). It shows that for the case of Indonesian, insurance company's financial performance has more dominant effect than intellectual capital.
Author Keywords: Canonical Model; Financial Performance; Granger Causality Model; Human Capital Efficiency; Intellectual Capital; Physical Employed Efficiency; Structural Capital Efficiency
References: Bollen, L., Vergauwen, P., Schnieders, S., Linking intellectual capital and intellectual property to company performance (2005) Management Decision, 43 (9), pp. 1161-1185; Chen, M.C., Cheng, S.J., Hwang, Y., An empirical investigation of the relationship between intellectual capital and firms market value and financial performance (2005) Journal of Intellectual Capital, 6 (2), pp. 159-176; Dae-Bong, K., (2009) Human Capital and Its Measurement, , The 3rd OECD World Forum on Statistics, Knowledge and Policy; El-Bannany, M., Global financial crisis and the intellectual capital performance of UAE banks (2012) Journal of Human Resource Costing, & Accounting, 16 (1), pp. 20-36; Lu, X., Su, L., White, H., (2011) Granger Causality and Structural Causality in Crosssection and Panel Data 2014, , Whites Econometric Theory Lectures at the 7th Symposium on Econometric Theory and Application (SETA; Marko, G., Human capital and knowledge audit as the competitive advantage of companies (2013) Net Journal of Social Sciences, 1 (1), pp. 1-4; Micah, L.C., Ofurum, C.O., Ihendinihu, J.U., Firms Financial Performance and Human Resource Accounting Disclosure in Nigeria (2012) International Journal of Business and Management, 7 (14), pp. 67-75; Mondal, A., Ghosh, S.K., Intellectual capital and financial, performance of Indian banks (2012) Journal of Intellectual Capital, 13 (4), pp. 515-530; Pulic, A., (2008) The Principles of Intellectual Capital Efficiency, , http://www.cik-hr.com/data/principles_2008.pdf, A Brief Description. Retrieved December 5, 2014 from; Rauch, A., Wiklund, J., Lumpkin, G.T., Frese, M., Entrepreneurial orientation and business performance: An assessment of past research and suggestion for the future (2009) Entrepreneurship Theory and Practice, 33 (3), pp. 1-54; Salicru, S., Perryer, C., Hancock, P., Intellectual capital and company performance-literature review and research opportunities in Australia (2007) 21st ANZAM 2007 Conference, p. 20. , In R. Authors: Hidayat C., Putong I., Utomo I.S.
Title: Corporate marketing strategy model (Case study in Indonesian insurance company)
Authors with affiliations: Hidayat, C., Management Department, Binus University11480, Indonesia; Putong, I., Management Department, Binus University11480, Indonesia; Utomo, I.S., Management Department, Binus University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to develop a model of corporate marketing strategy using six indicators of Arthur D Little which uses the company’ financial statements in the insurance field listed in Indonesian Stock Exchange. The number of samples used is equal to the number of population, such as nine companies that are still active in doing trading and reporting the financial statement periodically and published at stock exchange website. By using the interpretation, there are six indicators found as the Corporate Marketing Strategy. The result is standardized using the Zcore methods which are tested by Confirmatory Factor Analysis model. The given result is modeled by using Principal Component Analysis-Exploratory Factor Analysis, and retested by using the Confirmatory Factor Analysis. Therefore, given the result that it is initially come up as a Corporate Marketing Strategy that consists of six indicators variable with two variables factors, such as Effectiveness Strategy (product, management and system, technology, and operation strategy) and Efficiency Strategy factors (market and retrenchment strategy). © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: ADL corporate marketing strategy; Confirmatory factor analysis; Effectiveness strategy factor; Efficiency strategy factor; Exploratory factor analysis; Principal component analysis
References: Cravens, D.W., Piercy, N.F., (2009) Strategic Marketing, , 9th edn., McGrawhill International; Doncaster, C.P., Davey, A.J., (2007) Analysis of Variance and Covariance: How to Choose and Construct Models for the Life Sciences, , Cambridge University; Hair, J.F., Jr., Black, W.C., Babin, B.J., Anderson, R.E., (2010) Multivariate Data Analysis, , A Global Perspective, Pearson; Kotler, P., Keller, K.L., (2012) Marketing Management, pp. 14e. , Global edn., Pearson; Little, A.D., (2010) Marketingteacher, , http://com/lesson-store/lesson-a-d-little.html; Rufaidah, P., Stratejik, M., Pertama, E., Humaniora, P., (2012) Bandung
